lines.gurmukhi: 1 mMglwcrx kwdr dy cilq
lines.transliteration_english: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?

Shabad OS B.translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

lines.gurmukhi: ieku kvwau pswau kir EAMkwr Akwr bnwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Iku Kavaau Pasaau Kari Aoankaari Akaaru Banaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Diffusing His one vibration (vak, sound), Oaiikar has become manifest in the forms (of the whole creation).

lines.gurmukhi: AMbir Driq ivCoiV kY ivxu QMmw Awkwis rhwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Anbari Dharati Vichhorhi Kai Vinu Danmaan Aagaasu Rahaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Separating earth from sky, the Oankar has sustained sky without the support of any pillar.

lines.gurmukhi: jl ivic DrqI rKIAin DrqI AMdir nIru DrwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Jal Vichi Dharatee Rakheeani Dharatee Andari Neeru Dharaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He placed earth in water and water in the earth.

lines.gurmukhi: kwTY AMdir Agu Dir AgI hoNdI suPlu PlwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Kaatdai Andari Agi Dhari Agee Hondee Suphalu Phalaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Fire was put into wood and fire notwithstanding, the trees laden with beautiful fruits were created.

lines.gurmukhi: paux pwxI bYsMqro iqMny vYrI mylu imlwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Paoun Paanee Baisantaro Tinnay Vairee Mayli Milaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Air, water and fire are enemies of one another but He made them meet harmoniously (and created the world).

lines.gurmukhi: rwjs swqk qwmso bHmw ibsnu mhysu aupwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Raajas Saatak Taamaso Brahamaa Bisanu Mahaysu Oupaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He created Brahma, Visnu and Mahes'a who cherish the qualities of action (rajas), sustenance (sattv) and dissolution (tamas).

lines.gurmukhi: coj ivfwxu cilqu vrqwieAw ]1]
lines.transliteration_english: Choj Vidaanu Chalitu Varataaiaa ?1?

Shabad OS B.translation: Accomplisher of wondrous feats, that Lord created the wonderful creation.

lines.gurmukhi: 2 eISvrI SkqI

Shabad OS B.translation: Divine Power

lines.gurmukhi: isv skqI dw rUp kir sUrj cMd crwg blwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Siv Sakatee Daa Roop Kari Sooraju Chandu Charaagu Balaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Siva and Sakti i.e. the supreme element in the form of consciousness and prakrti, the matter containing dynamic power in it were joined to create the world, and sun and moon were made its lamps.

lines.gurmukhi: rwqI qwry cmkdy Gir Gir dIpk joiq jgwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Raatee Taaray Chamakaday Ghari Ghari Deepak Joti Jagaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Shining stars in the night give the look of lamps lit in each house.

lines.gurmukhi: sUrju eykMkwru idhu qwry dIpk rUp lukwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Sooraju Aykankaaru Dihi Taaray Deepak Roopu Loukaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: In day time with the rise of one great sun , the stars in the form of lamps go into hiding.

lines.gurmukhi: lK drIAwau kvwau ivic qol Aqolu n qoil qulwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Dareeaau Kavaau Vichi Toli Atolu N Toli Tulaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: His one vibration (vak) contains millions of rivers (of life) and His matchless grandeurs cannot be measured.

lines.gurmukhi: EAMkwr Akwru ijis prvdgwru Apwru AlwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Aoankaaru Akaaru Jisi Paravadagaaru Apaaru Alaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The benevolent sustainer Lord has also manifested His form as Oankar.

lines.gurmukhi: Abgiq giq Aiq Agm hY AkQ kQw nh AlKu lKwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Abagati Gati Ati Agam Hai Akad Kadaa Nahi Alakhu Lakhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: His dynamism is latent, unapproachable and His story is ineffable.

lines.gurmukhi: suix suix AwKxu AwiK suxwieAw ]2]
lines.transliteration_english: Souni Souni Aakhanu Aakhi Sounaaiaa ?2?

Shabad OS B.translation: The basis of talk about the Lord is simply hearsay (and not the first hand experience).

lines.gurmukhi: 3 rcnw dI vic`qRqw

Shabad OS B.translation: Wonder of creation

lines.gurmukhi: KwxI bwxI cwr jug jl Ql qruvru prbq swjy
lines.transliteration_english: Khaanee Baanee Chaari Joug Jal Dal Taruvaru Parabat Saajay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Four mines of life, four speeches and four Ages included, the Lord created water, earth, trees, and mountains.

lines.gurmukhi: iqMn loA cOdh Bvx kir iekIh bHmMf invwjy
lines.transliteration_english: Tinn Loa Chaudah Bhavan Kari Ikeeh Brahamand Nivaajay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The one Lord created the three worlds, fourteen spheres and many universes.

lines.gurmukhi: cwry kuMfw dIp sq nau KMf dh idis vjix vwjy
lines.transliteration_english: Chaaray Koundaa Deep Sat Nau Khand Dah Disi Vajani Vaajay.

Shabad OS B.translation: For Him the musical instruments are being played at in all the ten directions, seven continents and nine divisions of the universe.

lines.gurmukhi: ieks ieks Kwix ivic iekIh iekIh lK aupwjy
lines.transliteration_english: Ikas Ikas Khaani Vichi Ikeeh Ikeeh Lakh Oupaajay.

Shabad OS B.translation: From each originating source, twenty-one lacs of creatures have been produced.

lines.gurmukhi: iekq iekq jUin ivic jIA jMqu Axgxq ibrwjy
lines.transliteration_english: Ikat Ikat Jooni Vichi Jeea Jantu Anaganat Biraajay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Then in each species innumerable creatures exist.

lines.gurmukhi: rUp AnUp srUp kir rMg ibrMg qrMg Agwjy
lines.transliteration_english: Roop Anoop Saroop Kari Rang Birang Tarang Agaajay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Incomparable forms and hues then appearnd in variegated waves (of life).

lines.gurmukhi: pauxu pwxI Gir nau drvwjy ]3]
lines.transliteration_english: Paounu Paanee Gharu Nau Daravaajay ?3?

Shabad OS B.translation: Bodies formed by the association of air and water, have nine doors each.

lines.gurmukhi: 4 crnwN dI vicqRqw

Shabad OS B.translation: Wonder of creation

lines.gurmukhi: kwlw Daulw rqVw nIlw pIlw hirAw swjy
lines.transliteration_english: Kaalaa Dhaulaa Ratarhaa Neelaa Peelaa Hariaa Saajay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Black, white, red, blue, yellow and green colours are adorning (the creation).

lines.gurmukhi: rsu ksu kir ivsmwd swdu jIBhuN jwp n Kwj AKwjy
lines.transliteration_english: Rasu Kasu Kari Visamaadu Saadu Jeebhahoun Jaap N Khaaj Akhaajay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Wondrous tastes of edible and inedible objects have been made which are known through the tongue.

lines.gurmukhi: imTw kauVw Ktu qursu iPkw swau slUxw Cwjy
lines.transliteration_english: Mitdaa Kaurhaa Khatu Turasu Dhikaa Saau Saloonaa Chhaajay.

Shabad OS B.translation: These tastes are sweet, bitter, sour, salty and insipid.

lines.gurmukhi: gMD sugMiD Avys kir coAw cMdn kysru kwjy
lines.transliteration_english: Gandh Sougandhi Avaysu Kari Choaa Chandanu Kaysaru Kaajay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Mixing many fragrances, the camphor, sandal and saffron have been created.

lines.gurmukhi: mydu kQUrI pwn Pulu AMbru cUr kpUr AMdwjy
lines.transliteration_english: Maydu Kadooree Paan Phulu Anbaru Choor Kapoor Andaajay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Others such as musk cat, musk, betel, flowers, incense, camphors etc are also held to be similar.

lines.gurmukhi: rwg nwd sMbwd bhu caudh ividAw Anhd gwjy
lines.transliteration_english: Raag Naad Sanbaad Bahu Chaudah Vidiaa Anahad Gaajay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Many are the musical measures, vibrations and dialogues, and through fourteen skills the unstruck melody rings.

lines.gurmukhi: lK drIAwau kroV jhwjy ]4]
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Dareeaau Karorh Jahaajay ?4?

Shabad OS B.translation: Lacs of rivers are there on which crores of ships ply.

lines.gurmukhi: 5 rcnw ivc mnuK dyh pwr auqwrw

Shabad OS B.translation: Among the entire creation only human beings attain liberation

lines.gurmukhi: sq smuMd AQwh kir rqn pdwrQ Bry BMfwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Sat Samound Adaah Kari Ratan Padaarad Bharay Bhandaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Variegated forms of agricultural products, medicines,clothings and foods have been created on earth.

lines.gurmukhi: mhIAl KyqI AauKDI Cwdn Bojn bhu ibsQwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Maheeal Khaytee Aoukhadhee Chhaadan Bhojan Bahu Bisadaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Variegated forms of agricultural products, medicines,clothings and foods have been created on earth.

lines.gurmukhi: qruvr CwieAw Pul Pl swKw pq mUl bhu Bwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Taruvar Chhaaiaa Phul Phal Saakhaa Pat Mool Bahu Bhaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Shady trees, flowers, fruits, branches, leaves, roots exist there.

lines.gurmukhi: prbq AMdir AstDwqu lwlu jvwhru pwrsu pwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Parabat Andari Asat Dhaatu Laalu Javaaharu Paarasi Paaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: In the mountains are eight metals, rubies, jewels, philosopher's stone and mercury.

lines.gurmukhi: caurwsI lK join ivic imil imil ivCuVy vf prvwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Chauraaseeh Lakh Joni Vichi Mili Mili Vichhurhay Vad Paravaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Among the eighty four Lacs of species of life, large families meet only to part i.e. they take birth and die.

lines.gurmukhi: jMmxu jIvxu mrx ivic Bvjl pUr Brwie hjwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Janmanu Jeevanu Maran Vichi Bhavajal Poor Bharaai Hajaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: In the cycle of transmigration the herds of creatures in this world -ocean come and go in thousands..

lines.gurmukhi: mwxs dyhI pwir auqwrw ]5]
lines.transliteration_english: Maanas Dayhee Paari Outaaraa ?5?

Shabad OS B.translation: Only through the human body one can get across.

lines.gurmukhi: 6 mwxs jnm qy Bu`l

Shabad OS B.translation: Human birth and error of life

lines.gurmukhi: mwxs jnm dulMBu hY iCx BMgru Cl dyhI Cwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Maanas Janam Dulabhu Hai Chhin Bhangaru Chhal Dayhee Chhaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Though human birth is a rare gift, yet this body being made of clay is momentary.

lines.gurmukhi: pwxI dw kir pUqrw aufY n pauxu Kuly nau duAwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Paanee Daa Kari Poutalaa Udai N Paounu Khulay Naoun Duaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Made from ovum and semen, this airtight body has nine doors.

lines.gurmukhi: Agin kuMf ivic rKIAin nrk Gor mihN audru mJwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Agani Kound Vichi Rakheeani Narak Ghor Mahin Udaru Majhaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: That Lord saves this body even in the hellish fire of the mother's womb.

lines.gurmukhi: krY aurD qpu grB ivic csw n ivsrY isrjxhwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Karai Uradh Tapu Garabh Vichi Chasaa N Visarai Sirajanahaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: During pregnancy the creature hangs upside down in the mother's womb and continuously meditates.

lines.gurmukhi: dsI mhInI jMimAwN ismrx krI kry insqwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Dasee Maheeneen Janmiaan Simaran Karee Karay Nisataaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: After ten months the ftv takes birth when because of that meditation it is liberated from that pool of fire.

lines.gurmukhi: jMmdo mwieAw moihAw ndir n AwvY rKxhwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Janmado Maaiaa Mohiaa Nadari N Aavai Rakhanahaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Right from the time of birth he gets engrossed in maya and now that protector Lord is not beheld by him.

lines.gurmukhi: swhoN ivCuiVAw vxjwrw ]6]
lines.transliteration_english: Saahon Vichhurhiaa Vanajaaraa ?6?

Shabad OS B.translation: Jiv the travelling trader thus gets separated from the Lord, the great banker.

lines.gurmukhi: 7 mwxs jnm- mwXw jwl

Shabad OS B.translation: Human birth--a web of maya -

lines.gurmukhi: rovY rqnu gvwie kY mwieAw mohu Anyru gubwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Rovai Ratanu Gavaai Kai Maaiaa Mohu Anayru Goubaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Losing the jewel (in the form of the name of the Lord) the creature (on his birth) wails and weeps in utter darkness of maya and infatuation.

lines.gurmukhi: Ehu rovY duKu Awpxw his his gwvY sB prvwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Aohu Rovai Doukhu Aapanaa Hasi Hasi Gaavai Sabh Paravaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He cries because of his own suffering but the whole family sings merrily.

lines.gurmukhi: sBnwN min vwDweIAwN rux JuMJnVw rux Juxkwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Sabhanaan Mani Vaadhaaeeaan Roun Jhujhanarhaa Roun Jhounakaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The heart of all is full of happiness and musical sound of drums is heard all around.

lines.gurmukhi: nwnku dwdku sohly dyin AsIswN bwlu ipAwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Naanaku Daadaku Sohalay Dayni Aseesaan Baalu Piaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Singing songs of happiness maternal and paternal families bless the beloved child.

lines.gurmukhi: cuKhuN ibMdk ibMdu kir ibMdhuN kIqw prbq Bwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Choukhahoun Bindak Bindu Kari Bindahoun Keetaa Parabat Bhaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: From a small drop it increased and now that drop looks like a mountain.

lines.gurmukhi: siq sMqoK dieAw Drmu ArQu sugrQ ivswir ivswrw
lines.transliteration_english: Sati Santokh Daiaa Dharamu Aradu Sougarad Visaari Visaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Having grown up, he has with pride forgotten the truth, contentment, compassion, dharma and higher values.

lines.gurmukhi: kwm kroDu ivroD ivic loBu mohu DRoh AhMkwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Kaam Karodhu Virodhu Vichi Lobhu Mohu Dharoh Ahankaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He started living among desires, anger, oppositions, greed, infatuation, treachery and pride,

lines.gurmukhi: mhwN jwl PwQw vycwrw ]7]
lines.transliteration_english: Mahaan Jaal Dhaadaa Vaychaaraa ?7?

Shabad OS B.translation: And thus the poor fellow got entangled in the larg web of maya..

lines.gurmukhi: 8 bwlk bu`iD Acyq

Shabad OS B.translation: Child's intellect is unconscious

lines.gurmukhi: hoie sucyq Acyq iev AKIN hoNdI AMnHw hoAw
lines.transliteration_english: Hoi Souchayt Achayt Iv Akheen Hondee Annhaa Hoaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The jiv though consciousness incarnate is so much unconscious (of his aim in life) as if he is blind though having the eyes;

lines.gurmukhi: vYrI imqu n jwxdw fwiexu mwau suBwau smoAw
lines.transliteration_english: Vairee Mitu N Jaanadaa Daainu Maau Soubhaau Samoaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Does not distinguish between a friend and a foe; and according to him the nature of a mother and a witch is identical.

lines.gurmukhi: bolw kMnI hoNdeI jsu Apjsu mohu Dohu nw soAw
lines.transliteration_english: Bolaa Kanneen Honvadee Jasu Apajasu Mohu Dhohu N Soaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He is deaf despite ears and does not distinguish between glory and infamy or between love and treachery.

lines.gurmukhi: guMgw jIBY huMdIAY duDu ivic ivsu Goil muih coAw
lines.transliteration_english: Goungaa Jeebhai Houndeeai Dudhu Vichi Visu Gholi Muhi Choaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He is dumb despite tongue and drinks poison mixed in milk.

lines.gurmukhi: ivhu AMmiRq smsr pIAY mrx jIvn Aws qRws n FoAw
lines.transliteration_english: Vihu Anmrit Samasar Peeai Maran Jeevan Aas Traas N Ddhoaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Considering poison and nectar identical he drinks them

lines.gurmukhi: srpu Agin vil hQu pwie krY mnorQ pkV KloAw
lines.transliteration_english: Sarapu Agani Vali Hadu Paai Karai Manorad Pakarhi Khaloaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: And for his ignorance about life and death, hopes and desires, he gets no refuge anywhere.

lines.gurmukhi: smJY nwhI itbw toAw ]8]
lines.transliteration_english: Samajhai Naahee Tibaa Toaa ?8?

Shabad OS B.translation: He stretches his desires towards snake and fire and catching hold of them does not distinguish between a pit and a mound.

lines.gurmukhi: 9 bwlk ivcwr hInqw

Shabad OS B.translation: Child's thoughtlessness

lines.gurmukhi: lUlw pYrI hodeI tMgwN mwir n auiT KloAw
lines.transliteration_english: Loolaa Pairee Honvadee Tangaan Maari N Outdi Khaloaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Though with feet, a child (man) is cripple and cannot stand upon his legs.

lines.gurmukhi: hQo hQu ncweIAY Awsw bMDI hwru proAw
lines.transliteration_english: Hado Hadu Nachaaeeai Aasaa Bandhee Haaru Paroaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Weamig the garland of hopes and desises he dances in the arms of others.

lines.gurmukhi: audm aukiq n AwveI dyih ibdyih n nvwN inroAw
lines.transliteration_english: Udam Oukati N Aavaee Dayhi Bidayhi N Navaan Niroaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He knows neither technique nor enterprise, and being careless toward the body, he does not keep fit and healthy.

lines.gurmukhi: hgx mUqx Cfxw rogu sogu ivic duKIAw roAw
lines.transliteration_english: Hagan Mootan Chhadanaa Rogu Sogu Vichi Doukheeaa Roaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Having no control over his excretory organs of uinating and defecation he cries of disease and suffering.

lines.gurmukhi: GutI pIAY n KusI hoih sphuM riKAVw AxKoAw
lines.transliteration_english: Ghoutee Peeai N Khousee Hoi Sapahoun Rakhiaarhaa Anakhoaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He does not take the first food (of the name of the Lord) happily and goes on catching snakes (in the form of passions and desires) stubbornly.

lines.gurmukhi: guxu Avgux n ivcwrdw n aupkwru ivkwru AloAw
lines.transliteration_english: Gounu Avagoun N Vichaaradaa N Oupakaaru Vikaaru Aloaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Never pondering upon merits and demerits and not becoming benevolent, he always looks at evil propensities.

lines.gurmukhi: smsr iqsu hQIAwru sMjoAw ]9]
lines.transliteration_english: Samasari Tisu Hadeeaaru Sanjoaa ?9?

Shabad OS B.translation: For such a (foolish) person, the weapon and the armour are identical.

lines.gurmukhi: 10 mwqw aupkwr

Shabad OS B.translation: Benefactions of mother

lines.gurmukhi: mwq ipqw imil inMimAw AwswvMqI audru mJwry
lines.transliteration_english: Maat Pitaa Mili Nimiaa Aasaavantee Udaru Majhaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: Meeting and mating of mother and father makes the mother pregnant who becoming hopeful keeps the child in her womb.

lines.gurmukhi: rs ks Kwie inlj hoie Chu Chu Drix DrY pg Dwry
lines.transliteration_english: Ras Kas Khaai Nilaj Hoi Chhuh Chhuh Dharani Dharai Pag Dhaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: She enjoys edibles and unedibles without any inhibition and moves carefully with measured steps on the earth.

lines.gurmukhi: pyt ivic ds mwh riK pIVw Kwie jxY puqu ipAwry
lines.transliteration_english: Payt Vichi Das Maah Rakhi Peerhaa Khaai Janai Poutu Piaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: She gives birth to her dear son after bearing the pain of carrying him in her womb for ten months.

lines.gurmukhi: jx kY pwlY kst kir Kwn pwn ivic sMjm swry
lines.transliteration_english: Jan Kai Paalai Kasat Kari Khaan Paan Vichi Sanjam Saaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: Having delivered, the mother nourishes the child and herself remains moderate in eating and drinking.

lines.gurmukhi: guVHqI dyie ipAwil duDu GutI vtI dyie inhwry
lines.transliteration_english: Gurhhatee Dayi Piaali Dudhu Ghoutee Vatee Dayi Nihaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: Having ministered the customary first food, and milk, she stares at him with deep love.

lines.gurmukhi: Cwdnu Bojnu poiKAw JMfn mMgn pVHn icqwry
lines.transliteration_english: Chhaadanu Bhojanu Pokhiaa Bhadani Mangani Parhhani Chitaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: She thinks about his food, clothes, tonsure, betrothal, education etc.

lines.gurmukhi: pwNDy pwis bhwilAw Kit lutwie hoie suicAwry
lines.transliteration_english: Paandhay Paasi Parhhaaiaa Khati Loutaai Hoi Souchiaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: Throwing handful of coins over his head and giving him a proper bath she sends him to the pundit for education.

lines.gurmukhi: Airxq hoey Bwru auqwry ]10]
lines.transliteration_english: Urinat Hoi Bhaaru Outaaray ?10?

Shabad OS B.translation: This way she clears the debt (of her motherhood).

lines.gurmukhi: 11 mwqw aupkwr, pu`qR Apkwr

Shabad OS B.translation: Benefaction of mother and maltreatment of son) ,

lines.gurmukhi: mwqw ipqw AnMd ivic puqY dI kuVmweI hoeI
lines.transliteration_english: Maataa Pitaa Anad Vichi Poutai Dee Kurhamaaee Hoee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Parents are happy that the betrothel ceremony of their son has been solemnized.

lines.gurmukhi: rhsI AMg n mwveI gwvY soihlVy suK hoeI
lines.transliteration_english: Rahasee Ang N Maavaee Gaavai Sohilarhay Soukh Soee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Mother becomes overjoyed and sings songs of happiness.

lines.gurmukhi: ivgsI puqR ivAwihAY GoVI lwvwN gwv BloeI
lines.transliteration_english: Vigasee Pout Viaahiai Ghorhee Laavaan Gaav Bhaloee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Singing eulogies of bridegroom, and praying for the welfare of the couple she feels very happy that her son got married.

lines.gurmukhi: suKwN suKY mwvVI puqu nUMh dw myl AloeI
lines.transliteration_english: Soukhaan Soukhai Maavarhee Poutu Noonh Daa Mayl Aloee.

Shabad OS B.translation: For the well-being and harmony of bride and bridegroom the mother makes vows of offerings (before the deities).

lines.gurmukhi: nuhu inq kMq kumMqu dyie ivhry hovin ssu ivgoeI
lines.transliteration_english: Nuhu Nit Kant Koumantu Dayi Viharay Hovahu Sasu Vigoee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Now, the bride starts ill-advising the son, goading him to get separate from the parents, and consequently the mother-in-law becomes sorrowful.

lines.gurmukhi: lK aupkwru ivswir kY puqu kupuiq ckI auiT JoeI
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Oupakaaru Visaari Kai Pout Koupouti Chakee Outdi Jhoee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Forgetting lacs of benefactions (of mother) the son becomes disloyal and sets himself at logger-heads with his parents.

lines.gurmukhi: hovY srvx ivrlw koeI ]11]
lines.transliteration_english: Hovai Saravan Viralaa Koee ?11?

Shabad OS B.translation: Rare is any obdient son like Sravan of mythology who was most obedient to his blind parents.

lines.gurmukhi: 12 mwipAwN dw aupkwr ivswrnw pwp hY

Shabad OS B.translation: lt is sin to forget the benefactions of parents

lines.gurmukhi: kwmix kwmixAwrIAY kIqo kwmxu kMq ipAwry
lines.transliteration_english: Kaamani Kaamaniaareeai Keeto Kaamanu Kant Piaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: The enchantress wife with her charms made the husband dote on her.

lines.gurmukhi: jMmy sweIN ivswirAw vIvwihAw mwN ipE ivswry
lines.transliteration_english: Janmay Saaeen Visaariaa Veevaahiaan Maan Pia Visaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: He forgot the parents who had given him birth and had got him married.

lines.gurmukhi: suKwN suiK ivvwihAw sauxu sMjogu ivcwir ivcwry
lines.transliteration_english: Soukhaan Soukhi Vivaahiaa Saounu Sanjogu Vichaari Vichaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: Having made vows of offerings and considerd many good and bad omens and auspicious combinations, his marriage had been arranged by them.

lines.gurmukhi: puq nUhYN dw mylu vyiK AMg n mwvin mwN ipau vwry
lines.transliteration_english: Pout Noohain Daa Maylu Vaykhi Ang Naa Maavani Maan Piu Vaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: Seeing at the meetings of the son and the daughter-in-law, the parents had felt overjoyed.

lines.gurmukhi: nuMhu inq mMq kumMq dyie mwN ipE Cif vfy hiqAwry
lines.transliteration_english: Noonh Nit Mant Koumant Dayi Maan Piu Chhadi Vaday Hatiaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: The bride then started continuously advising the husband to desert his parents instigating that they had been tyrants.

lines.gurmukhi: vK hovY puqu rMin lY mwN ipau dy aupkwru ivswry
lines.transliteration_english: Vakh Hovai Poutu Ranni Lai Maan Piu Day Oupakaaru Visaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: Forgetting the benefactions of parents, the son alongwith his wife got separated from them.

lines.gurmukhi: lokwcwir huie vfy kucwry ]12]
lines.transliteration_english: Lokaachaari Hoi Vaday Kouchaaray ?12?

Shabad OS B.translation: Now the way of the world has become grossly immoral.

lines.gurmukhi: 13 mwipAwN dy ApkwrI dy jp qp insPl hn

Shabad OS B.translation: Pities of one who ill-treated the parents are in vain

lines.gurmukhi: mwN ipau prhir suxY vydu Bydu n jwxY kQw khwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Maan Piu Parahari Sounai Vaydu Bhaydu N Jaanai Kadaa Kahaanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Renouncing the parents, the listener of Vedas cannot understand their mystery.

lines.gurmukhi: mwN ipau prhir krY qpu vxKMif Bulw iPrY ibbwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Maan Piu Parahari Karai Tapu Vanakhandi Bhulaa Dhirai Bibaanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Repudiating the parents, meditation in the forest is similar to the wanderings at deserted places.

lines.gurmukhi: mwN ipau prhir krY pUju dyvI dyv n syv kmwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Maan Piu Parahari Karai Pooju Dayvee Dayv N Sayv Kamaanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The service and worship to the gods and goddesses are useless if one has renounced his parents.

lines.gurmukhi: mwN ipau prhir nHwvxw ATsiT qIrQ GuMmx vwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Maan Piu Parahari Nhaavanaa Atdasatdi Teerad Ghounman Vaanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Without service to the parents, bath at the sixty-eight pilgrimage centres is nothing but gyrating in a whirlpool.

lines.gurmukhi: mwN ipau prhir krY dwn byeImwn AigAwn prwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Maan Piu Parahari Karai Daan Bayeemaan Agiaan Paraanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The person who having deserted his parents performs charities, is corrupt and ignorant.

lines.gurmukhi: mwN ipau prhir vrq kir mir mir jMmY Brim BulwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Maan Piu Parahari Varat Kari Mari Mari Janmai Bharami Bhulaanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: He who repudiating the parents undertakes fasts, goes on to wander in the cycle of births and deaths.

lines.gurmukhi: guru prmysru swru n jwxI ]13]
lines.transliteration_english: Guru Paramaysaru Saaru N Jaanee ?13?

Shabad OS B.translation: That man (in fact) has not understood the essence of Guru and God.

lines.gurmukhi: 14 aupkwrI krqwr nUM sMBwl

Shabad OS B.translation: Cherish in heart the benevolent Creator

lines.gurmukhi: kwdru mnhuN ivswirAw kudriq AMdir kwdru idsY
lines.transliteration_english: Kaadaru Manahu Visaariaa Kudarati Andari Kaadaru Disai.

Shabad OS B.translation: In nature that creator is beheld but the jiv has forgotten him.

lines.gurmukhi: jIau ipMf dy swijAw sws mws dy ijsY iksY
lines.transliteration_english: Jeeu Pind Day Saajiaa Saas Maas Day Jisai Kisai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Bestowing body, vital air, flesh and breath upon every one, He has created one and all.

lines.gurmukhi: AKIN muhuN nku kMnu dyie hQu pYru siB dwq su iqsY
lines.transliteration_english: Akhee Muhu Naku Kannu Dayi Hadu Pairu Sabhi Daat Su Tisai.

Shabad OS B.translation: As gifts, eyes, mouth, nose, ears, hands, and feet have been given by Him.

lines.gurmukhi: AKIN dyKY rUp rMgu sbid suriq muih kMn sirsY
lines.transliteration_english: Akheen Daykhai Roop Rangu Sabad Surati Muhi Kann Sarisai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Man beholds form and colour through eyes and through mouth and ears he speaks and listens to the Word respectively.

lines.gurmukhi: nk vws hQIN ikrq pYrI clx pl pl iKsY
lines.transliteration_english: Naki Vaasu Hadeen Kirati Pairee Chalan Pal Pal Khisai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Smelling through nose and working with hands, he slides on his feet slowly.

lines.gurmukhi: vwl dMd mUMh rom rom sws igrwis smwil silsY
lines.transliteration_english: Vaal Dand Nahu Rom Rom Saasi Giraasi Samaali Salisai.

Shabad OS B.translation: He carefully keeps his hair, teeth, nails, trichomes, breath and food. Jiv, you getting controlled by the taste and greed always remember the worldly masters.

lines.gurmukhi: swdI lbY swihbo iqs qUM sMml sOvYN ihsY
lines.transliteration_english: Saadee Labai Saahibo Tis Toon Sanmal Saivain Hisai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Do remember that Lord too just one hundredth part of it.

lines.gurmukhi: lUx pwie kir AwtY imsY ]14]
lines.transliteration_english: Loonu Paai Kari Aatai Misai ?14?

Shabad OS B.translation: Put salt of devotion in the flour of life and make it tasteful.

lines.gurmukhi: 15 jwgidAwN jyhI surq qyhI spn ivc

Shabad OS B.translation: Same consciousness while waking as well as in dreaming

lines.gurmukhi: dyhI ivic n jwpeI nINd BuKu qyh ikQY vsY
lines.transliteration_english: Dayhee Vichi N Jaapaee Neend Bhoukhu Tayh Kidai Vasai.

Shabad OS B.translation: None knows the residing place of sleep and hunger in the body.

lines.gurmukhi: hsxu rovxu gwvxw iCk ifkwru KMGUrxu dsY
lines.transliteration_english: Hasanu Rovanu Gaavanaa Chhik Dikaaru Khangooranu Dasai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Let somebody tell where live the laughter, weeping, singing, sneezing, eructation and cough in the body.

lines.gurmukhi: Awlk qy AMgvwVIAwN ihfkI Kurkxu prs prsY
lines.transliteration_english: Aalak Tay Angavaarheeaan Hidakee Khurakanu Paras Parasai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Whence idleness, yawning, hiccough, itch, gaping, sighing, snapping and clapping?

lines.gurmukhi: auBy swh aubwsIAwN cutkwrI qwVI suix iksY
lines.transliteration_english: Oubhay Saah Oubaaseeaan Choutakaaree Taarhee Souni Kisai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Hope, desire, happiness, sorrow, renunciation, enjoyment, suffering , pleasure, etc. are indestructible emotions.

lines.gurmukhi: Awsw mnsw hrKu sogu jogu Bogu duKu suix n ivgsY
lines.transliteration_english: Aasaa Manasaa Harakhu Sogu Jogu Bhogu Doukhu Soukhu N Vinasai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Millions of thoughts and worries are there during waking hours

lines.gurmukhi: jwgidAwN lKu icqvxI suqw suhxy AMdir DsY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaagadiaan Lakhu Chitavanee Soutaa Suhanay Andari Dhasai.

Shabad OS B.translation: And the same get deeply rooted in mind while one is asleep and dreaming.

lines.gurmukhi: suqw hI brVwNvdw ikrq ivrq ivic js ApjsY
lines.transliteration_english: Soutaa Hee Bararhaanvadaa Kirati Virati Vichi Jas Apajasai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Whatever fame and infamy have been earned by man in his conscious state, he goes on muttering in sleep also.

lines.gurmukhi: iqsnw AMdir Gxw qrsY ]15]
lines.transliteration_english: Tisanaa Andari Ghanaa Tarasai ?15?

Shabad OS B.translation: Man controlled by desires, goes on intensely longing and yearning.

lines.gurmukhi: 16 durmqI- aupkwr kIqy bI nhIN sOrdw

Shabad OS B.translation: Even benevolence does not reclaim the evil person-

lines.gurmukhi: gurmiq durmiq vrqxw swDu AswDu sMgiq ivic vsY
lines.transliteration_english: Guramati Duramati Varatanaa Saadhu Asaadhu Sangati Vichi Vasai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Persons keeping company of sadhus and evilmen act according to the wisdom of Guru, gurmat, and illwill respectively.

lines.gurmukhi: iqMn vys jmvwr ivic hoie sMjogu ivjogu muxsY
lines.transliteration_english: Tinn Vays Jamavaar Vichi Hoi Sanjogu Vijogu Mounasai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Man acts according to three states of life (childhood, youth, oldage) subject to safijog, meeting, and vijog, separation.

lines.gurmukhi: shs kubwx n ivsrY isrjxhwru ivswir ivgsY
lines.transliteration_english: Sahas Koubaan N Visarai Sirajanahaaru Visaari Vigasai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Thousands of bad habits are not forgotten but the creature, RV feels happy forgetting the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: pr nwrI pr drbu ihqu pr inMdw prpMc rhsY
lines.transliteration_english: Par Naaree Par Darabu Haytu Par Nidaa Parapanch Rahasai.

Shabad OS B.translation: He enjoys in being with other's woman, other's wealth, and other's slander.

lines.gurmukhi: nwm dwn iesnwnu qij kIrqn kQw n swDu prsY
lines.transliteration_english: Naam Daan Isanaanu Taji Keeratan Kadaa N Saadhu Parasai.

Shabad OS B.translation: He has renounced rememberance of the Lord's name, charity and ablution and does not go to holy congregation to listen to discourses and kirtan, eulogies of the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: kuqw cauk cVHweIAY ckI ctix kwrx nsY
lines.transliteration_english: Koutaa Chaouk Charhhaaeeai Chakee Chatani Kaaran Nasai.

Shabad OS B.translation: He is like that dog who though placed in a high position, yet runs for licking the flourmills.

lines.gurmukhi: AvguixAwrw gux n srsY ]16]
lines.transliteration_english: Avagouniaaraa Goun N Sarasai ?16?

Shabad OS B.translation: Evil person never appreciates values of life.

lines.gurmukhi: 17 Anykqw ivc iek vXwpk hY so cyq

Shabad OS B.translation: Remember the One pervading the many

lines.gurmukhi: ija bhu vrn vxwspiq mUl pqR Plu Pulu Gnyry
lines.transliteration_english: Jiu Bahu Varan Vanaasapati Mool Patr Phul Phalu Ghanayray.

Shabad OS B.translation: One vegetation universely maintains of roots, leaves, flowers and fruits.

lines.gurmukhi: iek vrx bYsMqrY sBsY AMdir krdw fyry
lines.transliteration_english: Ik Varanu Baisantarai Sabhanaa Andari Karadaa Dayray.

Shabad OS B.translation: The same one fire resides in variegated objects.

lines.gurmukhi: rUpu AnUp Anyk hoie rMgu surMg su vwNs cMgyry
lines.transliteration_english: Roopu Anoopu Anayk Hoi Rangu Surangu Su Vaasu Changayray.

Shabad OS B.translation: The fragrance is the same which remains there in the materials of various hues and forms.

lines.gurmukhi: vwNshu auiT aupiT kir jwil krMdw BsmY Fyry
lines.transliteration_english: Vaansahu Outdi Oupanni Kari Jaali Karandaa Bhasamai Ddhayray.

Shabad OS B.translation: Fire emerges from within the bamboos and bums the whole vegetation to reduce it to ashes.

lines.gurmukhi: rMg ibrMgI gaU vMs AMgu AMgu Dir nwau lvyry
lines.transliteration_english: Rang Birangee Gaoo Vans Angu Angu Dhari Naau Lavayray.

Shabad OS B.translation: Cows of different colours are given different names. The milkman grazes them all but every cow listening to its name moves towards the caller.

lines.gurmukhi: sdI AwvY nwau suix pwlI cwrY myry qyry
lines.transliteration_english: Sadee Aavai Naau Souni Paalee Chaarai Mayray Tayray.

Shabad OS B.translation: Colour of the milk of every cow is the same (white).

lines.gurmukhi: sBnw dw ieku rMgu duD iGA pt BwNfY doK ny hyry
lines.transliteration_english: Sabhanaa Daa Iku Rangu Dudhu Ghia Pat Bhaandai Dokh N Hayray.

Shabad OS B.translation: Faults are not seen in ghee and silk i.e. one should not go for classes castes and varieties; only true humanity should be identified.

lines.gurmukhi: icqY AMdir cyqu icqyry ]17]
lines.transliteration_english: Chitai Andari Chaytu Chitayray ?17?

Shabad OS B.translation: 0 man, remember the artist of this artistic creation!

lines.gurmukhi: 18 Anykqw ivc iek krqy nUM kIqw nhIN cyqdw

Shabad OS B.translation: The creature does not remember unity in divesity of the creator

lines.gurmukhi: DrqI pwxI vwsu hY PulI vwsu invws cMgyrI
lines.transliteration_english: Dharatee Paanee Vaasu Hai Phulee Vaasu Nivaasu Changayree.

Shabad OS B.translation: Earth resides in water and fragrance resides in flowers.

lines.gurmukhi: iql PulwN dy sMig imil piqqu punIqu Pulyl GvyrI
lines.transliteration_english: Til Phulaan Day Sangi Mili Patitu Pouneetu Phulaylu Ghavayree.

Shabad OS B.translation: The degraded sesame seed mixing with the essence of flowers becomes sanctified as fragrant scent.

lines.gurmukhi: AKIN dyiK AnHyr kir mn AMDy qn AMD AMDyrI
lines.transliteration_english: Akhee Daykhi Anhayru Kari Mani Andhay Tani Andhu Andhayree.

Shabad OS B.translation: The blind mind even after beholding through the physical eyes, behaves like a creature living in darkness,i,e. man is spiritually blind though he beholds physically.

lines.gurmukhi: iCA ruq bwrh mwh ivic sUrj ieku n GuGU hyrI
lines.transliteration_english: Chhia Rout Baarah Maah Vichi Sooraju Iku N Ghoughoo Hayree.

Shabad OS B.translation: In all the six seasons and twelve months, the same one sun operates but the owl does not see it.

lines.gurmukhi: ismrx kUMj iDAwn kCu pQr kIVy irjk svyrI
lines.transliteration_english: Simarani Koonj Dhiaanu Kachhu Padar Keerhay Rijaku Savayree.

Shabad OS B.translation: Remembrance and meditation nurture the offsprings of florican and tortoise and that Lord provides livelihood to the worms of the stones as well.

lines.gurmukhi: krqY no kIqw n icqyrI ]18]
lines.transliteration_english: Karatay No Keetaa N Chitayree ?18?

Shabad OS B.translation: Even then the creature (man) does not remember that Creator.

lines.gurmukhi: 19 mnmuK sdw AMnHy hn

Shabad OS B.translation: Manmukhs, the mind-oriented, are blind

lines.gurmukhi: GuGU cwmicVk no dyhuN n suJY cwnx hoNdy
lines.transliteration_english: Ghoughoo Chaamachirhak No Dayhoun N Sujhai Chaanan Honday.

Shabad OS B.translation: Nothing can be seen by bat and owl in the day light.

lines.gurmukhi: rwiq AnHyrI dyKdy bolu kubolu Abolu KloNdy
lines.transliteration_english: Raati Anhayree Daykhaday Bolu Koubol Abol Khalonday.

Shabad OS B.translation: They see only in the dark night. They keep silent but as and when they speak their sound is evil.

lines.gurmukhi: mnmuK AMnHy rwiq idhuN suriq ivhUxy ckI JoNdy
lines.transliteration_english: Manamoukh Annhay Raati Dihoun Surati Vihoonay Chakee Jhonday.

Shabad OS B.translation: Manmukhs also remain blind day and night and being devoid of consciousness go on operating the quern of discord.

lines.gurmukhi: Aaugux cuix cuix Cif gux prhir hIry Ptk proNdy
lines.transliteration_english: Aougoun Chouni Chouni Chhadi Goun Parahari Heeray Dhatak Paronday.

Shabad OS B.translation: They pick up demerits and leave out merits; they reject the diamond and prepare the string of stones.

lines.gurmukhi: nwau sujwKy AMniHAwN mwieAw md mqvwly roNdy
lines.transliteration_english: Naau Sujaakhay Annhiaan Maaiaa Mad Matavaalay Ronday.

Shabad OS B.translation: These blind ones are called sujOns, the learned and intelligent ones. Inebrigated with the pride of their wealth they wail and weep.

lines.gurmukhi: kwm kroD ivroD ivic cwry ply Bir Bir DoNdy
lines.transliteration_english: Kaam Karodh Virodh Vichi Chaaray Palay Bhari Bhari Dhonday.

Shabad OS B.translation: Engrossed in lust, anger and antagonism they wash the four corners of their stained sheet.

lines.gurmukhi: pQr pwp n Cutih FoNdy ]19]
lines.transliteration_english: Padar Paap N Chhoutahi Ddhonday ?19?

Shabad OS B.translation: They never get liberated from carrying the load of their stony sins.

lines.gurmukhi: 20 mnmuK AMdir nUM Avgux krdw hY

Shabad OS B.translation: Manmukh returns evil for good done to him

lines.gurmukhi: QlwN AMdir Ak augvin vuTy mINh pvY muih moAw
lines.transliteration_english: Dalaan Andari Aku Ougavani Voutday Meenh Pavai Muhi Moaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Akk plant grows in sandy regions and during rain it falls on its face.

lines.gurmukhi: piq tutY duD vih clY pIqY kwlkUt Ehu hoAw
lines.transliteration_english: Pati Toutai Dudhu Vahi Chalai Peetai Kaalakootu Aohu Hoaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Milk oozes out of it when its leaf is plucked but it turns out to be poison when drunk.

lines.gurmukhi: AkhuN Pl huie KKVI inhPl so Pl Akiqfu BoAw
lines.transliteration_english: Akahoun Phal Hoi Khakharhee Nihaphalu So Phalu Akatidu Bhoaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The pod is a useless fruit of akk liked only by grasshoppers.

lines.gurmukhi: ivhu nsY Ak duD qy spu KwDw Kwie Ak nroAw
lines.transliteration_english: Vihu Nasai Ak Dudh Tay Sapu Khaadhaa Khaai Ak Naroaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The poison gets diluted by akk-milk and (sometimes) a person bitten by sanke gets cured of its poison.

lines.gurmukhi: so Ak cir kY bkrI dyie duDu AMmiRq moih coAw
lines.transliteration_english: So Ak Chari Kai Bakaree Dayi Dudhu Anmrit Mohi Choaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: When a goat grazes the same akk,it yeilds nectar-like drinkable milk.

lines.gurmukhi: spY duDu pIAwlIAY ivsu augwlY pwis KVoAw
lines.transliteration_english: Sapai Dudhu Peeaaleeai Visu Ougaalai Paasi Kharhoaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Milk given to snake is belched out by it instantly in the form of poison.

lines.gurmukhi: gux kIqy Avgux kir FoAw ]20]
lines.transliteration_english: Goun Keetay Avagounu Kari Ddhoaa ?20?

Shabad OS B.translation: The wicked person returns evil for good done to him.

lines.gurmukhi: 21 ingurw mnmuK v`s nhIN Aw skdw

Shabad OS B.translation: Man having no Guru is uncontrollable

lines.gurmukhi: kuhY ksweI bkrI lwie lUx sIK mwsu proAw
lines.transliteration_english: Kuhai Kasaaee Bakaree Laai Loon Seekh Maasu Paroaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The butcher slaughters goat and its meats is salted and strung on a skewer.

lines.gurmukhi: his his bolY kuhINdI KwDy Aku hwl ieh hoAw
lines.transliteration_english: Hasi Hasi Bolay Kuheendee Khaadhay Aki Haalu Ihu Hoaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Laughingly, the goat says while being killed that I have come to this condition only for grazing leaves of akk plant.

lines.gurmukhi: mws Kwn gl CurI dy hwl iqnwVw kauxu AloAw
lines.transliteration_english: Maas Khaani Gali Chhuree Day Haalu Tinaarhaa Kaounu Aloaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: But what will be the plight of those who cutting the throat with knife eat flesh (of animal).

lines.gurmukhi: jIBY hMdw PyiVAY Kau dMdwN muhu BMin ivgoAw
lines.transliteration_english: Jeebhai Handaa Dhayrhiaa Khau Dandaan Muhu Bhanni Vigoaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The perverted taste of the tongue is harmful for the teeth and damages the mouth.

lines.gurmukhi: pr qn pr Dn inMd kir hoAw dujIBw ibsIAru BoAw
lines.transliteration_english: Par Tan Par Dhan Nid Kari Hoi Dujeebhaa Biseearu Bhoaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The enjoyer of other's wealth, body and slander becomes a poisonous amphisbaena.

lines.gurmukhi: vis AwvY gurmMq suix ingurw mnmuK suxY n soAw
lines.transliteration_english: Vasi Aavai Guroumant Sapu Niguraa Manamoukhu Sounai N Soaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: This snake is controlled by the mantra of the Guru but manmukh, devoid of Guru, never listens to the glory of such mantra.

lines.gurmukhi: vyiK n clY AgY toAw ]21]
lines.transliteration_english: Vaykhi N Chalai Agai Toaa ?21?

Shabad OS B.translation: While moving ahead, he never beholds the pit before him.

lines.gurmukhi: 22 dUjw Bwau Kotw dwau hY

Shabad OS B.translation: The sense of duality is a wrong bet

lines.gurmukhi: Awip n vM\\\\Y swhurY lokwN mqIN dy smJwey
lines.transliteration_english: Aapi N Vanai Saahurai Lokaa Matee Day Samajhaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The wicked girl herself does not go to her father-in-law's house but teaches others how to behave at in -laws' house.

lines.gurmukhi: cwnxu Gr ivic dIivAhuN hyT AMnyru n skY imtwey
lines.transliteration_english: Chaananu Ghari Vichi Deeviahu Haytd Annayru N Sakai Mitaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Lamp can enlighten the house but it cannot dispel the darkness underneath itself.

lines.gurmukhi: hQu dIvw PiV AwKuVY huie ckcauDI pYr iQVwey ]
lines.transliteration_english: Hadu Deevaa Dharhi Aakhurhai Hui Chakachaudhee Pairu Dirhaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The man walking with lamp in hand stumbles because he is dazzled by its flame.

lines.gurmukhi: hQ kM|xu lY AwrsI AauKw hovY dyiK idKwey
lines.transliteration_english: Had Kannu Lai Aarasee Aoukhaa Hovai Daykhi Dikhaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: He who tries to see the reflection of his bracelet in a avast;

lines.gurmukhi: dIvw iekqu hQu lY AwrsI dUjY hiQ PVwey
lines.transliteration_english: Deevaa Ikatu Hadu Lai Aarasee Doojai Hadi Dharhaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Mirror worn on the thumb of the same hand can hardly see it or show it to other.

lines.gurmukhi: huMdy dIvy AwrsI AwKur toey pwauNdw jwey
lines.transliteration_english: Hounday Deevay Aarasee Aakhurhi Toay Paaoundaa Jaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Now if he catches hold of a mirror in one hand and lamp in the other even then he would stumble into a pit.

lines.gurmukhi: dUjw Bwau kudwau hrwey ]22]
lines.transliteration_english: Doojaa Bhaau Kudaau Haraaay ?22?

Shabad OS B.translation: Double-mindedness is an evil stake which ultimately causes defeat.

lines.gurmukhi: 23 mnmuK AkiRqGn hY

Shabad OS B.translation: Manmukh is ungrateful

lines.gurmukhi: AimA srovru mrY fuib qrY n mnqwrU su AvweI
lines.transliteration_english: Amia Sarovari Marai Doubi Tarai N Manataaroo Su Avaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: A headstrong non swimmer would drown and die even in the tank of nectar.

lines.gurmukhi: pwrs pris n p`QrhuN kMcn hoie n AGVu GVweI
lines.transliteration_english: Paarasu Parasi N Padarahu Kanchanu Hoi N Agharhu Ghurhaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Touching the philosopher's stone another stone does not transform into gold nor can it be chiselled into an ornament.

lines.gurmukhi: ibsIAru ivsu n prhrY AT phir cMnix lptweI
lines.transliteration_english: Biseearu Visu N Paraharai Atd Pahar Channani Lapataaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Snake does not shed its poison though it may remain entwined with sandalwood all the eight watches (day and night).

lines.gurmukhi: sMK smuMdhuN sKxw rovY DwhwN mwir suxweI
lines.transliteration_english: Sankh Samoundahu Sakhanaa Rovai Dhaahaan Maari Sounaai.

Shabad OS B.translation: In spite of living,in the sea, the conch remains empty and hollow and cries bitterly (when blown).

lines.gurmukhi: GuGU suJ n suJeI sUrju joiq n lukY lukweI
lines.transliteration_english: Ghoughoo Sujhu N Sujhaee Sooraju Joti N Loukai Loukaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Owl beholds nothing while nothing is hidden in sunshine.

lines.gurmukhi: mnmuK vfw AkiRqGn dUjY Bwie suAwie luBweI
lines.transliteration_english: Manamoukh Vadaa Akritaghanu Doojay Bhaai Suaai Loubhaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Manmukh, the mind-oriented, is very ungrateful and always likes to enjoy the sense of otherness.

lines.gurmukhi: isrjnhwr n iciq vsweI ]23]
lines.transliteration_english: Sirajanahaar N Chiti Vasaaee ?23?

Shabad OS B.translation: He never cherishes that creator Lord in his heart.

lines.gurmukhi: 24 ingurw pRwxI burw

Shabad OS B.translation: Man without Guru is the worst

lines.gurmukhi: mwN gBx jIA jwxdI puqu spuqu hovY suKdweI
lines.transliteration_english: Maan Gabhani Jeea Jaanadee Poutu Sapoutu Hovai Soukhadaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: A pregnant mother feels that a comfort giving worthy son will be born by her.

lines.gurmukhi: kpuqhuN DI cMgyrVI pr Gir jwie vswie n AweI
lines.transliteration_english: Koupoutahu Dhee Changayrarhee Par Ghar Jaai Vasaai N Aaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Better is a daughter than an unworthy son, she atleast would set up another' s home and would not come back (to put her mother to trouble).

lines.gurmukhi: kuDIAhuN sp skwrQw jwau jxyNdI jix jix KweI
lines.transliteration_english: Dheeahu Sap Sakaaradaa Jaau Janayndee Jani Jani Khaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Than wicked daughter, a female snake is better who eats its progeny at its birth (so that more snakes will not be there to put others to harm).

lines.gurmukhi: mwN fwiex DMn DMn hY kptI puqY Kwie AGweI
lines.transliteration_english: Maan Daain Dhannu Dhannu Hai Kapatee Poutai Khaai Aghaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Than female snake a witch is better who feels satiated after eating her treacherous son.

lines.gurmukhi: bwmHx gweI Kwie sp PiV gurmMqR pvwie ipVweI
lines.transliteration_english: Baamhan Gaaee Khaai Sapu Dharhi Gur Mantr Pavaai Pirhaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Even a snake, the biter of brahmins and cows, listening to the mantra of the Guru would quietly sit in a basket.

lines.gurmukhi: ingury quil n horu ko isrjxhwrY isriT aupweI
lines.transliteration_english: Niguray Tuli N Horu Ko Sirajanahaarai Siratdi Oupaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: But none is comparable(in wickedness) to a Guruless man in the whole universe created by the Creator.

lines.gurmukhi: mwqw ipqw n guru srxweI ]24]
lines.transliteration_english: Maataa Pitaa N Guru Saranaaee ?24?

Shabad OS B.translation: He never comes to the shelter of his parents or of the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: 25 ingury dw drSn burw hY

Shabad OS B.translation: Man without Guru is the worst

lines.gurmukhi: ingury lK n qul iqs ingury siqgur srix n Awey
lines.transliteration_english: Niguray Lakhan Tul Tis Niguray Satigur Sarin N Aaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: He who comes not in the shelter of the Lord God is incomparable even with millions of persons without Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: jo gur gopY Awpxw iqsu ifTy ingury srmwey
lines.transliteration_english: Jo Gur Gopai Aapanaa Tisu Ditday Niguray Saramaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Even the Guruless people feel shy of seeing the man who talks ill of his Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: sIh sauhwN jwxw Blw nw iqsu bymuK sauhwN jwey
lines.transliteration_english: Seenh Sauhaan Jaanaa Bhalaa Naa Tisu Baymoukh Sauhaan Jaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: It is better to face a lion than to meet that renegade man.

lines.gurmukhi: siqgur qy jo muhu iPrY iqs muih lgxu vfI blwey
lines.transliteration_english: Satiguru Tay Jo Muhu Dhirai Tisu Muhi Laganu Vadee Bulaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: To deal with a person who turns away from the true Guru is to invite disaster.

lines.gurmukhi: jo iqsu mwrY Drm hY mwir n hMGY Awpu htwey
lines.transliteration_english: Jay Tisu Maarai Dharam Hai Maari N Hanghai Aapu Hataaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: To kill such a person is a righteous act. If that cannot be done then one should oneself move away.

lines.gurmukhi: suAwim DohI AkiRqGx bwmx gaU ivswih mrwey
lines.transliteration_english: Suaami Dhrohee Akirataghanu Baaman Gaoo Visaahi Maraaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Ungrateful person betrays his master and treacherously kills brahmins and cows.

lines.gurmukhi: bymuK lUMA n quil qulwey ]25]
lines.transliteration_english: Baymoukh Looa N Tuli Tulaai ?25?

Shabad OS B.translation: Such renegade is not. equal in value to one trichome.

lines.gurmukhi: 26 juAwrIey dw jnm hwrxw

Shabad OS B.translation: Wasting the life by the gambler

lines.gurmukhi: mwns dyih dulMBu hY jugh jugMqir AwvY vwrI
lines.transliteration_english: Maanas Dayhi Dulabhu Hai Jougah Jougantari Aavai Vaaree.

Shabad OS B.translation: After many ages comes the turn of assuming the human body.

lines.gurmukhi: auqm jnmu dulMBu hY iek vwkI koVmw vIcwrI
lines.transliteration_english: Outamu Janamu Dulabhu Hai Ik Vaakee Korhamaa Veechaaree.

Shabad OS B.translation: It is a rare boon to be born in a family of truthful and intelligent people.

lines.gurmukhi: dyih Arog dulMBu hY BwgTu mwq ipqw ihqkwrI
lines.transliteration_english: Dayhi Arog Dulabhu Hai Bhaagatdu Maat Pitaa Hitakaaree.

Shabad OS B.translation: Almost rare to be healthy and to have beneficent and fortunate parents who can take care of the well-being of the child.

lines.gurmukhi: swDU sMig dulMBu hY gurmuiK suKPl Bgiq ipAwrI
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhu Sangi Dulabhu Hai Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Bhagati Piaaree.

Shabad OS B.translation: Also rare is the holy congregation and loving devotion, the pleasure fruit of gurrnukhs.

lines.gurmukhi: PwQw mwieAw mhwN jwil pMj dUq jmkwl su BwrI
lines.transliteration_english: Dhaadaa Maaiaa Mahaan Jaali Panji Doot Jamakaalu Su Bhaaree.

Shabad OS B.translation: But the Jiv, caught in the web of five evil propensities bears the heavy punishment of Yama, the god of death.

lines.gurmukhi: ijau kir shw vhIr ivic pr hiQ pwsw pauCik swrI
lines.transliteration_english: Jiu Kari Sahaa Vaheer Vichi Par Hadi Paasaa Paouchhaki Saaree.

Shabad OS B.translation: The state of  jiv becomes the same as that of a hare caught in a crowd. The dice being in other's hand the whole game goes topsyturvy.

lines.gurmukhi: dUjY Bwie kudwieAV jm jMdwru swr isr mwrI
lines.transliteration_english: Doojay Bhaai Kudaaiarhi Jam Jandaaru Saar Siri Maaree.

Shabad OS B.translation: The mace of Yama falls on the head of a jiv who gambles about in duality.

lines.gurmukhi: AwvY jwey BvweIAY Bvjlu AMdir hoie KuAwrI
lines.transliteration_english: Aavai Jaai Bhavaaeeai Bhavajalu Andari Hoi Khuaaree.

Shabad OS B.translation: Such a creature entangled in the cycle of the transmigration goes on suffering disgrace in the world-ocean.

lines.gurmukhi: hwrY jnm Amolu juAwrI ]26]
lines.transliteration_english: Haarai Janamu Amolu Juaaree ?26?

Shabad OS B.translation: Like a gambler he loses and wastes his precious life.

lines.gurmukhi: 27 caupV dI Kyl vw|U gurmuK pugdy hn

Shabad OS B.translation: Gurmukhs win as in a game of oblong dice

lines.gurmukhi: iehu jgu caupV Kylu hY Awvw gaux Baujl sYNswry
lines.transliteration_english: Ihu Jagu Chaouparhi Khaylu Hai Aavaa Gaoun Bhaujal Sainsaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: This world is a game of oblong dice and the creatures go on moving in and out of the world-ocean.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK joVw swDsMig pUrw siqgur pwir auqwry
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Jorhaa Saadhasangi Pooraa Satigur Paari Outaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: Gurmukhs join the association of the holy men and from there the perfect Guru (God) takes them across.

lines.gurmukhi: lg jwie so pug jwie gur prswdI pMj invwry
lines.transliteration_english: Lagi Jaai So Pougi Jaai Gur Parasaadee Panji Nivaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: He who devotes his self to the Guru, becomes acceptable and the Guru dispels away his five evil propensities.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK shij suBwau hY AwphuN burw nw iksY ivcwry
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Sahaji Soubhaau Hai Aapahoun Buraa N Kisai Vichaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: The gurmukh remains in a state of spiritual calm and he never thinks ill of anybody.

lines.gurmukhi: sbd suriq ilv swvDwn gurmuiK pMQ clY pgu Dwry
lines.transliteration_english: Sabad Surati Liv Saavadhaan Guramoukhi Pand Chalai Pagu Dhaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: Attuning consciousness with the Word, the gurmukhs alertly move with firm feet on the path of the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: lok vyd guru igAwn miq Bwie Bgiq guru isK ipAwry
lines.transliteration_english: Lok Vayd Guru Giaan Mati Bhaai Bhagati Guru Sikh Piaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: Those Sikhs, dear to the Lord Guru, behave in accordance with morality, religious scriptures and the wisdom of the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: inj Gir jwie vsY gurduAwry ]27]
lines.transliteration_english: Nij Ghari Jaai Vasai Guru Duaaray ?27?

Shabad OS B.translation: Through the means of the Guru, they stabilize in their own self.

lines.gurmukhi: 28 AMnHw AwgU

Shabad OS B.translation: If a blind becomes a leader

lines.gurmukhi: vwNs sugMiD n hoveI crxodk bwvn bohwey
lines.transliteration_english: Vaas Sougandhi N Hovaee Charanodak Baavan Bohaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Bamboo does not become fragrant but by the wash of Gum's feet, this also becomes possible.

lines.gurmukhi: kchuN kMcn nw QIAY kchuN kMcn pwrs lwey
lines.transliteration_english: Kachahu Kanchan N Deeai Kachahoun Kanchan Paaras Laaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Glass does not become gold but with the impact of philosopher's stone in the form of Guru, glass also transforms into gold.

lines.gurmukhi: inhPl isMmul jwxIAY APl sPl kir sB Pl pwey
lines.transliteration_english: Nihaphalu Sinmalu Jaaneeai Aphalu Saphalu Kari Sabh Phalu Paaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Silk-cotton tree is supposed to be fruitless but that too (by the grace of Guru) becomes fruitful and gives all sorts of fruits.

lines.gurmukhi: kwauN n hovin aujly kwlI hUM Dauly isir Awey
lines.transliteration_english: Kaaoun N Hovani Ujalay Kaalee Hoon Dhaulay Siri Aaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: However, manmukhs like crows never change into white from black even if their black hair become white i.e. they never leave their nature even in old age.

lines.gurmukhi: kwg vMs huie prmhMs inrmolku moqI cuix Kwey
lines.transliteration_english: Kaagahu Hans Hui Dharam Hansu Niramolaku Motee Chouni Khaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: But (by the grace of the Gum) the crow changes into swan and picks up invaluable pearls to eat.

lines.gurmukhi: psU proqhuN dyv kir swDsMgiq guru sbd kmwey
lines.transliteration_english: Pasoo Paraytahoun Dayv Kari Saadh Sangati Guru Sabadi Kamaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The holy congregation transforming beasts and ghosts into gods, causes them to realize the word of the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: iqs guru swr n jwqIAw durmiq dUjy Bwie luBwey
lines.transliteration_english: Tis Guru Saar N Jaateeaa Duramati Doojaa Bhaai Soubhaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Those wicked ones who are engrossed in the sense of duality have not known the glory of the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: AMnHw AwgU swQ muhwey ]28]
lines.transliteration_english: Annaa Aagoo Saadu Muhaaay ?28?

Shabad OS B.translation: If the leader is blind, his companions are bound to be robbed of their belongings.

lines.gurmukhi: 29 inMmRqw au`qm aupdyS

Shabad OS B.translation: Humility the best teaching

lines.gurmukhi: mY jyhw n AikrqGxu hY iB n hoAw hovixhwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Mai Jayhaa N Akiratighanu Hai Bhi N Hoaa Hovanihaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Neither there is, nor there will be an ungrateful person like me.

lines.gurmukhi: mY jyhw n hrwmKoru horu n koeI AvguixAwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Mai Jayhaa N Haraamakhoru Horu N Koee Avagouniaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: None is there subsisting on evil means and a wicked person like me.

lines.gurmukhi: mY jyhw inMdku n koie guru inMdw isir bjru Bwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Mai Jayhaa Nidaku N Koi Guru Nidaa Siri Bajaru Bhaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: No slanderer is there like me carrying on his head the heavy stone of the slander of the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: mY jyhw bymuKu n koie siqguru qy bymuK hiqAwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Mai Jayhaa Baymoukhu N Koi Satiguru Tay Baymoukh Hatiaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: No one is a savage apostate like me turning away from the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: mY jyhw ko dust nwih inrvYrY isau vYr ivkwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Mai Jayhaa Ko Dousat Naahi Niravairai Siu Vair Vikaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: None other is an evil person like me who has enmity with persons having no hostility.

lines.gurmukhi: mY jyhw n ivsws DRoih bgl smwDI mIn Ahwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Mai Jayhaa N Visaahu Dhrohu Bagal Samaadhee Meen Ahaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: No treacherous person equals me whose trance is like crane's who picks up fish for food.

lines.gurmukhi: bjr lyp n auqrY ipMf Aprcy Aaucir cwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Bajaru Laypu N Outarai Pindu Aparachay Aouchari Chaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: My body, ignorant of Lord's name, eats inedibles and the layer of stony sins on it cannot be taken off.

lines.gurmukhi: mY jyhw n dubwjrw qij gurmiq durmiq ihqkwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Mai Jayhaa N Doubaajaraa Taji Guramati Duramati Hitakaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: No bastard is like me who repudiating the wisdom of the Guru has deep attachment with wickedness.

lines.gurmukhi: nwauN murId n sbd vIcwrw ]29]
lines.transliteration_english: Naau Mureed N Sabadi Veechaaraa ?29?

Shabad OS B.translation: Though my name is disciple,I have never reflected upon the Word (of the Guru).

lines.gurmukhi: 30 auho hI

Shabad OS B.translation: Humility the best teaching

lines.gurmukhi: bymuK hovin bymuKwN mY jyhy bymuK muK ifTy
lines.transliteration_english: Baymoukh Hovani Baymoukhaan Mai Jayhay Baymoukhi Moukhi Ditday.

Shabad OS B.translation: Seeing the face of an apostate like me, the apostates beome more deep -rooted apostates.

lines.gurmukhi: bjr pwpwN bjr pwp mY jyhy kir vYrI ieTy
lines.transliteration_english: Bajar Paapaan Bajar Paap Mai Jayhay Kari Vairee Itday.

Shabad OS B.translation: The worst sins have become my beloved ideals.

lines.gurmukhi: kir kir isTwN bymuKwN AwphuN bury jwx kY isTy
lines.transliteration_english: Kari Kari Sitdaan Baymoukhaan Aapahoun Buray Jaani Kai Sitday.

Shabad OS B.translation: Considering them apostates I taunted them (though I am worse than them).

lines.gurmukhi: ilK n skin icqRgupiq sq smuMd smwvn icTy
lines.transliteration_english: Likh N Sakani Chitr Goupati Sat Samound Samaavani Chitday.

Shabad OS B.translation: The story of my sins cannot be written even by Yama's scribes because the record of my sins would fill the seven seas.

lines.gurmukhi: icTI hUM qUmwr iliK lK lK iekdUM iek duiDTy
lines.transliteration_english: Chitdee Hoon Toumaar Likhi Lakh Lakh Ikadoon Ik Dudhitday.

Shabad OS B.translation: My stories would get multiplied further into lacs each one doubly shameful than the other.

lines.gurmukhi: kir kir swNg huryihAwN huie mskrw sBw siB iTTy
lines.transliteration_english: Kari Kari Saang Hurayhiaan Hui Masakaraa Sabh Sabhi Ritday.

Shabad OS B.translation: So much I have mimed others so often that all buffoons feel ashamed before me.

lines.gurmukhi: mYQhuN burw n koie sirTy ]30]
lines.transliteration_english: Maidahu Buraa N Koee Saritday ?30?

Shabad OS B.translation: None is worse than me in the whole creation.

lines.gurmukhi: 31 gurU drgwh dw ku`qw

Shabad OS B.translation: A dog of the Guru's court

lines.gurmukhi: lYlI dI drgwh dw kuqw mjnUM dyiK luBwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Lailay Dee Daragaah Daa Koutaa Majanoon Daykhi Loubhaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Beholding the dog of Laild's house, Majana was charmed.

lines.gurmukhi: kuqy dI pYrIN pvY hiV hiV hsY lok ivfwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Koutay Dee Pairee Pavai Harhi Harhi Hasai Lok Vidaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He fell at the feet of dog seeing which people laughed roaringly.

lines.gurmukhi: mIrwsI mIrwsIAwN nwm DrIku murId ibbwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Meeraasee Meeraaseeaan Naam Dhareeku Mureedu Bibaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Out of (Muslim) bards one bard became disciple of Baia (Nanak).

lines.gurmukhi: kuqw fUm vKwxIAY kuqw ivic kuiqAwN inmwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Koutaa Doom Vakhaaneeai Koutaa Vichi Koutiaan Nimaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: His companions called him a dog-bard, even among dogs a lowly one.

lines.gurmukhi: gurisK Awsk sbd dy kuqy dw pVkuqw Bwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Gurasikh Aasaku Sabad Day Koutay Daa Parhakoutaa Bhaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: TheSikhs of the Guru who were suitors of the Word (the Brhm) took a fancy to that so-called dog of dogs.

lines.gurmukhi: ktin ctin kuiqAwN mohu n Dohu DiRgsq kmwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Katanu Chatanu Koutiaan Mohu N Dhohu Dhrigasatu Kamaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Biting and licking is the nature of dogs but they have no infatuation, treachery or cursedness.

lines.gurmukhi: AvguixAwry guxu krin gurmuiK swDsMgiq kurbwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Avagouniaaray Gounu Karani Guramoukhi Saadhasangati Kurabaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The gurmukhs are sacrifice unto the holy congregation because it is benevolent even to the evil and wicked persons.

lines.gurmukhi: piqq auDwrx ibrdu vKwxw ]31]37]
lines.transliteration_english: Patit Udhaaranu Biradu Vakhaanaa ?31?37?saintee?

Shabad OS B.translation: Holy congregation is known for its reputation as uplifter of the fallen ones.

lines.gurmukhi: <> siqgur pRswid ]
lines.transliteration_english: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?

Shabad OS B.translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

lines.gurmukhi: pUrn bHm gur byl huie cMbylI giq mUl swKw pqR kir ibibD ibQwr hY
lines.transliteration_english: Pooran Braham Gur Bayl Hui Chanbaylee Gati , Mool Saakhaa Patr Kari Bibidh Bidaar Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Satguru, manifestation of Almighty God, is like jasmine creeper of which He Himself is the root and all His devotees and pious persons are its leaves and branches.

lines.gurmukhi: gurisK puhp subws inj rUp qw mY pRgt huie krq sMswr ko auDwr hY
lines.transliteration_english: Gursikh Puhap Soubaas Nij Roop Taa Mai , Pragat Hui Karat Sansaar Ko Udhaar Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Pleased at the services of His devotees (like Bhai Lehna Ji, Baba Amar Das Ji, etc.) Satguru turns those devotees by His grace and makes them into fragrance-spreading flowers and by manifesting in them is liberating the world.

lines.gurmukhi: iql imil bwsnw subws ko invws kir Awpw Koie hoie hY Pulyl mhkwr hY
lines.transliteration_english: Til Mili Baasanaa Soubaas Ko Nivaas Kari , Aapaa Khoi Hoi Hai Dhulayl Mahakaar Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as sesame seed loses its existence and becomes scent when unites with the fragrance of the flowers, the devotees too lose themselves to the Lord through meditation and spread divine fragrance in the world.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK mwrg mY piqq punIq rIiq sMswrI huie inrMkwrI praupkwr hY ]37]
lines.transliteration_english: Gurmukhi Maarag Mai Patit Pouneet Reeti , Sansaaree Hui Nirankaaree Paraoupakaar Hai ?37?

Shabad OS B.translation: Sikhism has a tradition of changing sinners into holy persons. And in this path, this is a very righteous task and service towards others. Those engrossed in material world are converted into God-loving and godly persons. They are detached from maya (mamm
